reviewText:
DON'T PAY MONEY FOR THIS.

This game was probably made in less than a single day, maybe even as practice for some programming class. Not only is slow, repetitive and boring: it's also flawed to its core mechanics. The levels are so small that enemies spawn on top of you. All you can do is walk in a small circle while shooting the enemies chasing you. Is the art interesting at least? No, just MS paint sprites. The story? No story is revealed to the player. The music? Gets annoying after half a minute.

It seems the developer didn't even bother trying the game him/herself: looking at all the screenshots provided in the store page at the moment of posting this review, you can see how ALL of them have the same amount of gold 99991601" which is many orders of magnitude higher than what you get playing the game. How did the dev go through many levels without gaining or losing gold and achieving such an incredible quantity of coins? Obviously because he/she cheated for the sole purpose of taking the screenshots without having to actually play this pile of sh*t.

This game has no redeeming elements and could be a contender of "worst game on Steam". It's a shame this is being sold
date: even if it was for just 1 cent.\n\nBut that's not all
recommended: it gets even worse: this game has "Mostly Positive" reviews
hoursPlayed: with 72% of 148 reviews being positive. How could this happen? Simple

reviewText:
Invasion seems a game made in a hurry, with a soundtrack annoying, there are not any options, so no full screen or else ..
It 'a shame, but in person the game is not worth the money it costs, there are many miglioramente to do, especially the gameplay, which I found too easy and slow.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AfcGKxgjf-U

(Below is the Italian full review)
Invasion è un gioco ARCADE in stile retro, la base del gameplay è quello della sopravvivenza, uccidendo più alieni e mostri possibili, ottenendo così nuove armi e nuove armature.
Nel gioco ci sono una grande varietà di livelli, da quelli innevati a battaglie spaziali in stile giochi anni 90.

Parere Personale:
Invasion sembra un gioco fatto di fretta e furia , con una soundtrack fastidiosa, non ci sono neanche le opzioni, quindi nessun full screen o altro..
E' un peccato, ma personalmente il gioco non vale i soldi che costa, e i miglioramenti da fare sono tanti, soprattutto il gameplay, che ho trovato troppo semplice e lento.

Da prendere a pochissimo solo per le carte.

reviewText: Invasion is fifteen levels of terrible arena shooter and five levels of terrible top-down shooter. If you try to play this game straight through, you might notice that the first level starts out decently tough. Everything is a little rough around the edges, but if things keep going this way, it might almost be sort of fun, but probably not. Then you come to the second level, which is impossible. The rest of the game consists of an endless grind of the same levels and bosses in order to collect the coins necessary to power up your armor and weapons so that you can beat the next level. It's tiresome, boring, and there isn't a single thing about it that's worth the time and effort it requires of the player. If there's anything good to be said about Invasion, it's that if you really give it a chance, it's all over in two hours.

reviewText:
So, let's sum this up:
- An MSPaint art style
- A very limited number of levels
- Terrible economy in-game
- Very little balance

The screenshots show that the player has TONS of money, this clearly shows that the devs didn't even bother to test how the economy actually worked in-game.

Overall, it's a rushed game that clearly wasn't tested before release.

reviewText:
Cons:
The menu is terrible
Way too hard, at least not in a pleasant way. No possible way to go through a level without getting damaged
Mob spawns are terrible
Monsters are not unique in any way
Inconsistency overall
Coin-grinding & unbalanced coin economy.
No story
Hard to imagine there were any playtesting prior to releasePros:
Decent soundtrack Possible solutions:
Make mobs drop something else than coins (hp, bombs, speed boosts)
Spawns need to be more consistent, not directly on the player.
Get rid of the shop and find a different way to grind weapons / gears.
Add some story, what is happening, who is this kid we are playing and so on.
The game needs to be more easy to begin with and needs to have at least the possibility of a unharmed run.
More option for the player instead of just running & shooting.
Conclusion:
I don't recommend this game in current state, even if it were free. I highly suspect early positive" reviews are fake."
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
This is a 2d shooter and it's barely playable game.

Let me get this straigth - you can beat this game in under 1,5 hour but most of the times is taken by repeating boss stages as it scores 400 cash after such stage.

Best weapon in game costs 3500 and fully upgrading it costs about another 6000 cash.

First levels are a real pain - you start with some kind of a pea shooter as it takes 3-4 bullets to kill a simple alien and this gun shoots oh-boy-so-slow.

If you somehow did not delete this game after 15 minutes then you are somehow able to finish it. The path to success is fairly simple:
- somehow get to stage 5 and beat the first boss
- repeat unless you have 900 cash and get rocket launcher
- now, with rocket launcher, beating boss from stage 5 is simpler as it takes about 30 seconds in contrast to above 2 minutes with starting pea shooter, even after upgrades
- repeat unless you get one or two rocket and armor upgrades
- go up to level 10 and beat boss from this level
- repeat level 10 until you get this 3500 cash gun and until you can upgrade it to the max level
- if you have this Laser Stick upgraded to the max level then you can go up to level 20 and beat the game with ease, buying armor upgrades from time to time

Also - 5 trading cards, who-wee.

In conclusion - just don't bother. Go and grab yourself a beer for that 2 euros. Or pack of crisps if you're not yet of age. Or buy some coca cola instead. You get the point.

How such games end up in Steam store is just beyond my knowledge.

----------
For anyone interested in joining in on completing your own backlog; check it out here - http://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog/discussions/5/530645446320364338/

reviewText:

Unsure why, but this game gives off a strong vibe of an older game without trying to force the impression like many other games.

To keep my review from being confusing: the graphics aren't great, the enemies are generic and the game itself is as simple as it gets. Still I enjoy playing and trying to beat it.
